name: De W.
text:
They promise you ethical treatment, integrity & flawless service. Don't believe it.
Once carpet was selected - salesman assured quality professional installers in a timely manner.
The installer arrived late; talking highly of himself and did not reply or respond when asked questions. Once carpet installed, we inspected job. Carpet had high strips where Sean's were like the carpet was doubled at the seam. I pointed it out to installer (Terry), and he pulled on it saying it won't come loose. I said I wasn't worried about it coming loose but the seam was obviously thick.
He ignored my concern. A week later I called back and spoke to sales person who came our days later to look at it. It took another week to get a call back where salesman asked for a convenient time for installer to come back. I gave him 2-days and timetable around my work schedule. Salesman said he would call installer and get back with me on day & time. I was assured installer would be back to repair on one of the days I provided but he would call back to confirm.
On the day installer was suppose to be here for repair I received a call from installer saying he was calling to set up the appointment. What?! You were were suppose to be here....
I called the store and I got excuses from the lady sales person saying the installer was trying to call me.
Don't bother calling these people..they don't know what they're doing and they are not customer service conscious. I won't be using them again.

text:
I had them do my entire house that was empty. They started late, and then rushed the job as the movers were coming. I had issues right after they finished, my first contact after the job was Oct 31.  I have many text, but still haven't fixed the problem, even now July 5..

My next door neighbor who had Got Wood do her floors is beautiful, I will say that in a heart beat.  That is why I hired them to do mine. Got Wood suggested I get my tile from Lowe's as he thought it would look good in my condo, the tile cost more then the tile I was going to get, but he was the "pro". I ordered the tile, and James (Got Wood) bought the grout. I had to wait over a week for him to start on my floors after it all came in.  What has really got my goat is when he lies about his sorry work, and me getting drunk (I don't drink), and having a party. Two days after he finished, the painters came in, when they finished the movers came. He never came back to really clean the floors like he said he was going to.

resp.text: First of all I would like to say that some people you can never make happy and since Judy wanted to call and make a complaint on the company that did the work in her house there is five other houses in her neighborhood that was tile and wood floors done in there and not one problem has occurred from the beginning we was rushed to this job so she could move across the street I went back to her house several times to address areas that was not cleaned that had grout powder still in the cracks after we acid washed and mopped I went back five other times to just wipe up stuff for her or look at stuff that she thought was a problem this is how it all occurred Judy went to Lowe's and purchased her tile and her grout herself I gave her some ideas on what to buy but I also told her to make sure that she checked the edges of the tile and made sure that all tile was covered her tile edges are great and the floor is brown so when you put wood tile together in the light shines in at a certain angle it is showing a gray line I told Judy to contact the company where she purchased the tile from and get them to come look at the tile and find out what was wrong in my eyes it was a defect I also recommended that she change her grout color because she picked a lighter color that she is not happy with herself so therefore my company is not to go in scrape out sanded grout and put in non sanded black grout so that this problem would be solved she buys a pen and wants me and my gas to come to her house and draw on every piece of tile that is not our job we are tile installers removers and sellers we do not set and draw on Floors if there is a defect from the company if I purchase it I would handle it so therefore Judy's complaint is all on her herself it has nothing to do with me and my company there's five other people in her same neighborhood that we have done the floors for and there's not one complaint not one callback not nothing this is the only person in the neighborhood and what a coincidence that people in the neighborhood complain on this also the time that we was installing the tile they was drinking having party time and walked on top of the tile after we left me and my boys went back and fix the tile the next day for free we told them do not walk on the tile at all none whatsoever and we had to fix tile the two or three days that we was there I don't have no complaints about my customers and what day do I fix what they mess up and I didn't even charge so therefore I'm very sorry that she is unhappy I done everything I could in my power to make her happy but I'm not

text: Sept 2016 James installed hard wood floors through out our new house, after many calls and many excuses as why he could not make it to the house.after floors were installed numerous calls to James to come and fix new floor only weeks old at this time.james came and looked and agreed that floors had to be taken up and redone.james had many excuses as why it was not his fault.james exact word was not to worry,i will take care of you,i promise!!!! fast forward to march2018 James has not done anything to fix the problem.so my experience with James at got wood was not a pleasant one. James never came back. I judge a man who keeps his word,his word and his work is not to be taken seriously.

resp.text: Let's tell the truth James come up and looked at the floors several times James did not go back in sand the floors because they had issues with the subfloor sagging over a 3/4 of an inch they had to also go back in and rebrace all flooring a year-and-a-half after the job was already done I told them to fix the subfloor before I would resend anyting because I wasn't doing it for free again it shouldn't be free this time but I told him I would do it for them so if everybody wants to talk garbage talk the right garbage or unload the truth

Hi David,

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. First, we would like to apologize you are experiencing concerns with your flooring. We are truly sorry for your frustration. Your satisfaction is important to us, and we want to ensure any concerns you have are properly addressed as promptly as possible. We were able to locate your account and have notified your handling representative, as well as our regional managers. We will be in contact with you shortly, and look forward to resolving this matter.

Lauren R. Customer Advocate.

name: Ashlyn Jones
text: Really wish I could give 0/5 stars because that's exactly what you will get working with Issis and Sons Flooring. During our previous home renovation, everything this company touched had to be fixed twice. Bathroom tile was laid un-level and a cracked piece was installed. Not to mention, the guy used so much self leveler it leaked through into our basement! A complete mess! 1500 SQ FT of LVP had to be removed and reinstalled due to no prep work involved and cracked pieces installed. Most quarter round was cracked and not even stained on the ends. Not to mention, they could not even provide ONE piece of missing quarter round that was requested for two weeks. POOR QUALITY AND CRAFTSMANSHIP. Stairs were stained twice and still had paint brush bristle hairs in the stain. Called it quits with these guys and will find someone to finish the job they already started. BEWARE...it's not worth your time or money.

name: daniel weber
text:
The guy I spoke with had a terrible attitude.
I called there today and asked them to send one of their estimators over to do measurements and give me a bid on replacing carpet.

After I told him that I would like to have the opportunity to introduce myself our company and products to them as well, he was very rude and said that he didn't need my business, then hung up the phone.
I believe in doing business with organizations that want to do business with you and keeping money local.
Apparently this gentleman has all the business he needs and doesn't care about local businesses.
DONT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE, WHEN THERE ARE MANY OTHER (LOCAL) FLOORING COMPANIES THAT WOULD LOVE TO WORK WITH YOU AND EARN YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Sue Irwin
text: I bought 3 rugs from Issis for my new house to put on my refinished hardwood  floors,   The rugs are beautiful and Issis came and installed them.  I later learned that the pads they had put underneath them were cheap and could deteriorate .  My the time I found out and replaced them my new hardwood floors already had spots where the pad had stuck to the floor and left a sticky residue.  You would think after buying expensive rugs that Issis would put better pads under them or at least tell you that you needed to buy pads.  The fact that they put pad under them that could ruin my floors is appalling .

resp.text: Sue, our apology for the slow response. I took over for the role of communication manager recently and would like to know what we can do to make you happy. Please email me at issis.furniture1@gmail.com or contact your sales representative directly. Thank you
